product_metadata.product_name: Bajaj Life Invest Protect Goal III
product_metadata.plan_type: Unit-linked, Non-Participating, Individual Life Savings Insurance Plan
product_metadata.risk_disclaimer: Investment risk in the investment portfolio is borne by the policyholder.

product_summary.objective: Invest Protect Goal III is a ULIP savings plan that provides high life cover protection throughout the policy term along with market-linked returns, loyalty advantages, return of charges, and fund maintenance support.
key_highlights: Lump sum payout for loved ones in case of death
Market-linked returns to grow invested corpus
Return of Premium Allocation Charges (ROAC) at year 15
Return of Mortality Charges (ROMC) in multiple stages
Fund Maintenance Booster (FMB) ensures fund value does not fall below one annualized premium
Family Benefit of 1% at maturity (PT ≥ 20 years)
Lock-in period of 5 years as per ULIP regulations
product_summary.lock_in_rule: No surrender or partial withdrawal allowed during the first 5 policy years.

core_benefits.details: Higher of Prevailing Sum Assured or Regular Premium Fund Value, plus higher of Top-up Fund Value or Top-up Sum Assured.
core_benefits.guarantee: Minimum 105% of total premiums including Top-ups received up to date of death.
core_benefits.note: Sum Assured reduces by partial withdrawals made from Regular Premium Fund in last 2 years.

core_benefits.details: Total Fund Value payable on survival till maturity date.
At end of 15th policy year, all premium allocation charges (excluding GST) are added back to fund value.

schedule.year_7: 25% of mortality charges deducted till year 7
schedule.year_25_onwards: 100% charges returned in 5-year blocks until maturity

core_benefits.basis: Average of previous 3 years’ daily Regular Premium Fund Value

core_benefits.details: From 4th year onwards, if Total Fund Value falls below one Annualized Premium, insurer adds difference to restore it.
core_benefits.formula: FMB = Annualized Premium – Total Fund Value

core_benefits.details: If family member is an existing Bajaj Life policyholder, 1% of average daily fund value is added at maturity.

switching_rules.free_switches: Unlimited free switches allowed (Investor Selectable Strategy)

automatic_transfer_strategy_rule.allocation: Premiums allocated to Bond Fund or Liquid Fund first, then systematically transferred monthly.

discontinuance_charge.year_1: Up to 20% of AP/FV (max ₹3,000 or ₹6,000 depending on premium)

charges_structure.mortality_charge: Deducted monthly on Sum At Risk

partial_withdrawals.condition: Regular Fund Value must remain ≥ 3× Annualized Premium

sum_assured_change.increase_or_decrease: Allowed at policy anniversaries (subject to underwriting)

surrender_rules.during_lock_in: Fund moved to Discontinued Life Policy Fund, payable after lock-in ends

revival.period: Within 3 years from first unpaid premium

riders.rider_name: Linked New Critical Illness Benefit Rider

compliance_rules.ulip_risk_warning: ULIPs are subject to capital market risks. NAV may go up or down based on market performance.
compliance_rules.lock_in_period: 5 years mandatory lock-in as per IRDAI guidelines.
compliance_rules.free_look_period: 30 days from receipt of policy document.
compliance_rules.suicide_exclusion: Within 12 months, nominee receives Total Fund Value as on death intimation date.
compliance_rules.fraud_warning: Beware of spurious phone calls and fictitious offers. IRDAI does not sell policies.
compliance_rules.tax_disclaimer: Tax benefits subject to Income Tax Act provisions and amendments.

retrieval_chunks.text: Death benefit is higher of Sum Assured or Fund Value, with minimum guarantee of 105% of premiums paid including top-ups.
ROAC returns premium allocation charges at year 15, while ROMC returns mortality charges progressively up to maturity.
Fund Maintenance Booster ensures fund value does not fall below one annualized premium by adding required difference.
Entry age is 18–60, policy term 20–40 years, minimum yearly premium starts at ₹18,000 for PPT ≥ 8 years.
Premium allocation charges apply up to 6%, policy administration charges capped at ₹500/month, FMC up to 1.35%.
